channel.title: Linux vs Windows
channel.description:
[center][img width=160 height=200]http://cavdar.net/uploads/2008/07/500px-newtuxsvg.png[/img][size=36pt][b]VS[/b][/size][img width=200 height=200]http://rocketdock.com/images/screenshots/windows_flag.png[/img][/center]
Here is how it will go down: Linux whores will post why they love linux, and Windowfags will post why they love Windows.
From there, we shall debate what makes each OS more elite than the other. We will dig out all the flaws and perfections of each Operating System. This is not meant to be a flame war of who's OS is better, but rather a way of us to figure out what OS is better for what.
[hr]
[b][i]Here is my argument.[/i][/b]
I personally love Linux. I love the stability and neatness of it. I also love being able to use other programs, such as screen, to be able to run other operations covertly, and without having the clutter of another window. I love having 2 separate workspaces. I love it being as quick as it is, and the ability to execute everything from a command line.
These are just some reasons why [b][u]I[/u][/b] love Linux.
[hr]
Please make all of your posts quality, and not spam. This is really meant to be an efficient discussion among the Operating Systems.

item.title: Linux vs Windows
item.dc:creator: @cocoa cocoa
item.description:
@cocoa wrote:

AMERIKA:

I’m loving how all the idiots say Windows. You must have no idea what Linux can really do.

can’t be fucked to learn. Ignorance is bliss.

Read full topic

item.title: Linux vs Windows
item.dc:creator: @Mr_Mopar1 Mr Mopar
item.description:
@Mr_Mopar1 wrote:

[quote=“AMERIKA, post:17, topic:327968”][quote author=Mr Mopar link=topic=424353.msg3116742#msg3116742 date=1265062028]
win fucking dows…
[/quote]
please elaborate why[/quote]

[code]

  1. It’s free…legally free.
  2. Almost every useful application you would ever want to run on Linux is free.
  3. When you want to update to the latest and greatest version, with all the latest and greatest features, you don’t need to buy a new version…and if you want to stick with the old, you can.
  4. Security. Defaults are much better than Windows. There are so many free options for increased security, SeLinux and Grsecurity just to name a couple.
  5. All you need to learn about it is out there somewhere, for free, whether it’s online, in a man page, or in a forum or newsgroup somewhere.
  6. Performance…Linux almost never forces you to upgrade your hardware, and it always runs better on older hardware than windows.
  7. Simplicity. Yes simplicity. Most young people think Windows is easy because that’s what they grew up with and had the most exposure to. That’s like someone in the US saying english is the simplest language.
  8. The choices…the free choices, are endless. What filesystem do you want to use, what do you want installed or not installed on your system, what graphical interface do you want to use and how do you want to configure it, which pdf viewer do you want to use, etc. Windows will never be that flexible.[/code]
    tbh,i found this on google…
    edit:shit i noticed this is for linux >.>

Read full topic

item.title: Linux vs Windows
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

Linux is technically a superior operating system in every way. What it lacks is support, give the industry a kick up the ass and make it support linux. Even if that meant introducing payment for services, it needs it. Linux is better at doing everything if they’re made for the system, yes, including games.

Don’t hate on linux, hate on the support.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @CAPT_AMERIKA AMERIKA
item.description:
@CAPT_AMERIKA wrote:

Fat Cookies:

You do not deserve the right to say that until you rm -rf GNOME. I still don’t understand how you can use bloated shit like GNOME but then use a nise minimalist irc client like irssi.

Linux is all about personal preference. I prefer the GNOME environment. I LIKE IT. I could care less what you say I should use, because I will use what I choose.
